intro: Philippia trichoclada subsp. latisepala, commonly known as the broad-sepal Philippia, is a species native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, elongated sepals that are broader than those of the typical species. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. The flowers are small, white or pale yellow, and are arranged in clusters, making it an attractive ornamental plant.
